TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed VerticalAlignment extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes how a child element is vertically positioned or stretched within a parent's layout slot.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Height%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Width%2A> properties that are explicitly set on an element take precedence over the <xref:System.Windows.HorizontalAlignment> property value.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the VerticalAlignment enumeration in code and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)].
[!code-cs[mpalayoutverticalalignment#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/MPA_Layout_VerticallAlignment/MPA_Layout_VerticalAlignment.cs#2)] [!code-xml[mpalayoutverticalalignment#2](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/MPA_Layout_VerticalAlignment/default.xaml#2)] [!code-vb[mpalayoutverticalalignment#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/MPA_Layout_VerticalAlignment/MPA_Layout_VerticalAlignment.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.VerticalAlignment Bottom = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The child element is aligned to the bottom of the parent's layout slot.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.VerticalAlignment Center = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The child element is aligned to the center of the parent's layout slot.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.VerticalAlignment Stretch = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The child element stretches to fill the parent's layout slot.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.VerticalAlignment Top = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The child element is aligned to the top of the parent's layout slot.
